comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Arthur Yager (October 29, 1858 – December 24, 1941) served as Governor of Puerto Rico from 1913 to 1921. ... During Yager's administration, and with his support, the United States Congress adopted the Jones-Shafroth Act (also called Jones Act) of 1917, which conferred United States citizenship on Puerto Ricans." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Yager
